name: Enhance Monkey Console Application

title: 'Enhance Monkey Console Application'
labels: ['enhancement', 'good first issue']
---

## Description
The Monkey console application is complete and includes an interactive menu, random monkey picker, search by name, access count tracking, and ASCII art. This issue tracks future improvements and enhancements.

## Requirements

- [ ] **Improve console UI formatting and colors** - Enhance the visual appearance of the console interface with better formatting and color support
- [ ] **Add persistence for monkey access counts** - Implement file-based or database storage to persist access count statistics between application sessions
- [ ] **Allow adding new monkey species dynamically** - Enable users to add new monkey species to the database from within the console application
- [ ] **Expand ASCII art support** - Add more detailed and diverse ASCII art representations for each monkey species

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Console UI displays with improved formatting and enhanced visual elements
- [ ] Access count data is saved to persistent storage (JSON file or database)
- [ ] Users can add new monkey species through the console menu
- [ ] Multiple ASCII art variations available for each monkey species
- [ ] All code follows project C# coding standards
- [ ] Code includes comprehensive XML documentation
- [ ] All features are tested and working as expected

## Related Components

This enhancement involves:
- Console UI improvements
- MonkeyHelper service enhancements
- Monkey model extensions
- Persistence layer implementation

## Notes

These enhancements will make the application more interactive, visually appealing, and feature-rich while maintaining the current architecture and coding standards.
